intro: Galium pulchellum, commonly known as the showy bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Galium pulchellum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
